abstract.text: Loads a sound asset from the argument URL and adds it to the engine’s list of registered assets.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: A URL to an audio file on disk. This function doesn’t support network URLs.
A unique name for the sound asset. If you provide
, the framework determines and sets value for the asset’s identifier.
The asset’s type.

An object that describes an audio channel layout to replace the asset’s channel layout. This channel layout needs to have the same channel count as the asset or this function returns an error. Some multichannel files—that is, files with more than two channels—don’t contain a channel layout. WAV files may not contain a channel layout, whereas CAF files normally do. This function checks if a channel layout exists in a file and if so, PHASE uses it.
If the asset is stereo or mono, you can pass
because the framework generates the channel layout for you in that case.
An option to calibrate the sound asset for the user’s output device.
A sound asset object. If an error occurs, the function returns
To expedite audio loading, run this function for multiple assets on multiple threads. This function runs synchronously. As a thread-safe function, you can run it off the main thread.

abstract.text: Create dynamic audio experiences in your game or app that react to events and cues in the environment.
A base class that adds a name to framework assets.
Options that determine how PHASE manages sound assets in memory.
A central repository of audio assets.
Loads a sound asset from memory and adds it to the engine’s list of registered assets.
Loads a sound asset from the argument URL and adds it to the engine’s list of registered assets.
Deallocates system memory for a given asset and removes it from the engine’s list of registered assets.
Options that determine whether the framework adjusts a sound asset’s loudness for the user’s output device.
A sound resource stored in the asset registry.
An object that describes the roles of a set of audio channels.
A value that identifies the location of a resource, such as an item on a remote server or the path to a local file.
A Unicode string value that is a collection of characters.

inlineContent.text: A URL to an audio file on disk. This function doesn’t support network URLs.
A unique name for the sound asset. If you provide
, the framework determines and sets value for the asset’s identifier.
The asset’s type.

An object that describes an audio channel layout to replace the asset’s channel layout. This channel layout needs to have the same channel count as the asset or this function returns an error. Some multichannel files—that is, files with more than two channels—don’t contain a channel layout. WAV files may not contain a channel layout, whereas CAF files normally do. This function checks if a channel layout exists in a file and if so, PHASE uses it.
If the asset is stereo or mono, you can pass
because the framework generates the channel layout for you in that case.
An option to calibrate the sound asset for the user’s output device.
On output, a pointer to an error object that describes why the method failed, or
if no error occurred. If you are not interested in the error information, pass
for this parameter.
A sound asset object. If an error occurs, the function returns
